title: Assertion Error
body_html:
Issue description

I am new with deep learning and pytorch. This is the first project I am trying to work.
I am training a network but when I run training commands I have the following error:

raise AssertionError("Invalid device id")
AssertionError: Invalid device id

Code example

python3 train.py --lr 0.0003 --batch-size 80 --arch resnet152
--data-name ucf101 --representation iframe
--data-root data/ucf101/mpeg4_videos
--train-list data/datalists/ucf101_split1_train.txt
--test-list data/datalists/ucf101_split1_test.txt
--model-prefix ucf101_iframe_model
--lr-steps 150 270 390 --epochs 510
--gpus 0 1 2 3

System Info

Processor: Intel® Xeon(R) CPU E3-1246 v3 @ 3.50GHz × 8
Graphic: GeForce GTX 1080/PCIe/SSE2
OS: Ubuntu 16.04 (64bit)

  • PyTorch
  • How you installed PyTorch: conda
  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04 (64bit)
  • PyTorch version: 0.4.0
  • Python version: 3
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 8
  • GPU models and configuration: GeForce GTX 1080/PCIe/SSE2
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): 5.4.0
  • CMake version:
  • Versions of any other relevant libraries:

body:
## Issue description
I am new with deep learning and pytorch. This is the first project I am trying to work. 
I am training a network but when I run training commands I have the following error:

raise AssertionError("Invalid device id")
AssertionError: Invalid device id


## Code example

python3 train.py --lr 0.0003 --batch-size 80 --arch resnet152 \
        --data-name ucf101 --representation iframe \
        --data-root data/ucf101/mpeg4_videos \
        --train-list data/datalists/ucf101_split1_train.txt \
        --test-list data/datalists/ucf101_split1_test.txt \
        --model-prefix ucf101_iframe_model \
        --lr-steps 150 270 390  --epochs 510 \
        --gpus 0 1 2 3

## System Info

Processor: Intel® Xeon(R) CPU E3-1246 v3 @ 3.50GHz × 8 
Graphic: GeForce GTX 1080/PCIe/SSE2
OS: Ubuntu 16.04 (64bit)


- PyTorch 
- How you installed PyTorch: conda
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04 (64bit)
- PyTorch version: 0.4.0
- Python version: 3
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 8
- GPU models and configuration: GeForce GTX 1080/PCIe/SSE2
- GCC version (if compiling from source): 5.4.0
- CMake version:
- Versions of any other relevant libraries:
